text: today's recipe yet another one of my
favorites it's sriracha honey walnut
shrimp so first you have to candy your
walnuts this is a third of a cup of
sugar and 1 tablespoon of water I'm just
looking forward to get to a very light
caramel stage this is just the beginning
to start turning a very pale golden add
a pinch of salt add your walnuts it's
1/2 a cup of walnuts and you just want
to toss these around in the caramel and
get them coated it's a very light
coating makes them crunchy make them as
salty as you want I like that contrast
and especially since this is going in
the savory dish you want that salt pour
them onto a baking sheet that's been
lined with parchment to set I'm gonna
make the sauce now it's a
mayonnaise-based sauce this is 1/3 of a
cup of mayonnaise and to that add a
tablespoon of honey and some sriracha
about three-quarters of a teaspoon
give or take as well as a little bit of
lemon juice about a teaspoon and a half
stir so that's your sauce you're gonna
save that for when your shrimp comes out
of the fryer did I say fryer yes I did
to make the batter for the frying you
need 1 large egg yolk it's basically
it's tempura batter one and a half cups
of club soda you could use beer or club
soda this is tempura so you don't really
want that beer flavor but both do the
same thing add lightness in your batter
add 1/2 a teaspoon of coarse salt and
then this is rice flour it's one and a
quarter cups and the reason we're using
rice flour is because it is the most
crispy batter that you will ever get you
want to fold this in you don't want to
over mix this but you want to make sure
that your flour is incorporated the last
thing is the shrimp it's a 1 and 1/2
pounds of shrimp just season it lightly
with some salt everything is seasoned
but I always like to season every layer
of what I'm doing give it a little toss
so you want to heat your oil about two
inches of oil to approximately 375 and
then working in batches you dip your
shrimp into the tempura batter and then
into the fryer now you want to keep the
oil temperature pretty even
as you add your shrimp the temperature
will drop and then it'll come back up
shrimp don't take too long to cook just
a couple minutes please feel like as
long as the oil temperature doesn't drop
below 350 I'm doing okay you see that
it's a very light coating but that's
nice gives it just a little bit of
crispness I'm gonna just keep frying
until you've used up all of your shrimp
time to sauce up your warm shrimp goes
into your sauce should be a light
coating give it a toss now you add your
walnuts and then to make it healthy
serve it on a bed of steamed broccoli
spoon over the top make sure to cover up
all the steamed broccoli with fried
shrimp and make sure to save the last
one for you
you
